questions.text: Germany should continue to provide military support to Ukraine.
The expansion of renewable energy should continue to be financially supported by the state.
Citizens' income shoudl be withdrawn from those who repeatedly refuse job offers.
A general speed limit should apply on all highways.
Asylum seekers who entered through another EU country should be turned away at Germany's borders.
Rent prices should continue to be legally capped for new leases.
The federal police should be allowed to use automated facial recognition software at train stations.
Energy-intensive companies should receive state financial compensation for their electricity costs
All employees should be allowed to retire without deductions after 40 years of contributions.
The opening sentence of the Basic Law should continue to include the phrase - responsibility before God -
Germany should continue to promote the recruitment of skilled workers from abroad.
Germany should resume using nuclear energy for electricity generation.
The top income tax rate should be increased.
The federal government should have more authority in education policy.
Germany should continue exporting arms to Israel
All citizens should be required to have public health insurance.
The legal gender quota for executive and supervisory boards of publicly listed companies shoudl be abolished.
Organic farming should receive more support than conventional farming.
The federal government should increase funding for projects against right-wing extremism.
Companies should continue to be required to monitor compliance with human rights and environmental standards by all their suppliers.
Studen financial aid (BAf√∂G) should continue to be based on parental income.
The debt brake in the Basic Law should be maintained.
Asylum seekers should receive a work permit immediately after submitting their application.
Germany should abandon its goal of becoming climate-neutral.
The 35-hour workweek should be established as the legal standard for all employees.
Abortions should continue to be punishable during the first three months unless preceded by counseling.
The euro should be replaced with a national currency in Germany.
When expanding transport infrastructure, rail should be prioritized over roads.
Voluntary work should count towards future pension entitlements.
Property tax should continue to be passed on to tenants.
The right to strike for employees in critical infrastructure sectors should be legally restricted.
National referendums should be introduced at the federal level in Germany.
Children under the age of 14 should be able to be held criminally responsible.
Germany should advocate for the abolition of increased EU tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles.
It should remain generally possible to hold a second citizenship alongside German citizenship.
A mandatory social service year should be introduced for young adults.
New heating systems should still be allowed to run entirely on fossil fuels (e.g. gas or oil)
The statutory minimum wage should be raised to 15 euros by 2026 at the latest.
